intro: Pinardia frutescens, commonly known as the pinkroot or red root, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its roots are reddish in color and have been used traditionally in herbal medicine. Pinardia frutescens is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and stabilizing soil in wetland habitats.
